DOC.detailed_description: `` Safer Sex Skills Building '' Pregnant Women : Dace Svikis , ( Psychology , Ob-Gyn , Psychiatry ) PI , Diane Langhorst ( Social Work ) Nichole Karjane , ( OB-Gyn ) Co-Investigators ) . This study focus increase Safer Sex Skills development among pregnant woman high risk HIV infection . The `` Safer Sex Skill Building '' ( SSB ) program develop El Bassel Schilling ( 1991 , 1992 ) , demonstrate efficacy national study reduce sexual risk HIV STD transmission . This manual-driven , gender-specific intervention proven effective reduce sexual risk behavior methadone maintenance outpatient drug-free patient . To date , however , intervention test pregnant drug abuse woman may actually increase risk stop use condom continue drug use pregnancy . This study examine SSB , target behavioral HIV prevention risk reduction intervention two sample pregnant drug abuse woman . Using 2x2 design , randomize clinical trial compare five-session SSB group intervention one-session standard group HIV Education intervention ( SE ) . Study finding provide benchmark data efficacy SSB HIV STD prevention diverse sample pregnant drug abuse woman .
